newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Standard Chartered to set HK$2 bln FRCD.
newsitem.headline: Standard Chartered to set HK$2 bln FRCD.

text.p: Standard Chartered Bank plans to launch a HK$2 billion floating rate certificates of deposit issue into general syndication this week, bankers said.
They said the facility has a final maturity of three years. It will be priced at par to float at 20 basis points over the one-month Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate.
With fees, the all-in return for top-tier managers is 25 basis points, bankers noted.
The issuer is self-arranging the deal.
The co-arranger group includes BNP Hong Kong, HSBC Markets and LTCB Asia.
Application will be made to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority to accept the issue as eligible for use at its Liquidity Adjustment Facility (LAF), or discount window.
The issuer is rated A2 by Moody's Investors Service and Single-A by Standard and Poor's Corp.
The certificates will be issued off the borrower's HK$10 billion CD programme.
An issue specific rating is being sought.
